field.label: Enable Multi-Process Generation
field.tooltip:
Multi-Process Optimization significantly boosts the image optimization speed. But it generates extra load to the server as well. We recommend first to run the test image optimization process with the 'multi-process' ON and monitor your server performance.

The 'Multi-Process Generation' feature needs the php extension 'pcntl' to be installed on the server. If you enable the feature and no performance boost happens, plase ask your hoster/system administrator to check if the 'pcntl' extension installed.

field.label: Number of Parallels Processes
field.tooltip: The more parallel processes are set, the faster is the image optimization process, as well as the higher is the server load

field.label: Process Images per Request
field.tooltip: The more images are processed per request, the faster the optimization process is. But keep in mind that your server load is higher as well.

field.label: Use User Agent for Loading Images
field.tooltip:
Using user Agent allows to apply such features as Smart Optimization+Resize together with the Lazy Load feature for the same image as well as to set the number of preloaded images separately for desktop and mobile views.

There could be a situation, when User Agent doesnâ€™t work properly for some reasons and should be switched OFF. In this case only preloaded images can be served with Smart Optimization+Resize features while Lazy Load is enabled. And if Lazy Load feature is disabled all images can be served with Smart Optimization+Resize features.
field.comment: Please note that the User Agent functionality works only with Smart Optimization strategy.

field.label: Image Replace Strategy
field.tooltip:
According to the settings options, you can choose one of the optimization strategies:

None: no optimization strategy is selected.

Smart optimization: includes WebP and Image Resolutions, and additionally, the AVIF image compression format for Pro and Premium versions. Since AVIF is not supported by all browsers, the choice of image compression format depends on the browser being used. AVIF will be applied in supported browsers, while in cases where this is not possible, WebP and Image Resolutions will be used (note: AVIF functionality is available as part of an active product or support subscription).

SpeedSize (is available for Pro and Premium versions): a solution based on neurobiological optimization of multimedia that allows you to maintain high quality and speed of loading images.

field.label: Support Third-party Image Attributes
field.comment: Specify each attribute from a new line or leave empty if it shouldn't be used.
field.tooltip: Example: <img src="placeholder-image.png data-src="original-image.png"/> In this case 'data-src' - it's a third-party attribute, so you need to prescribe it in the field if you want images with this attribute to be replaced with WebP format.
